messages.subject: Re: OT - Gaelic/Celtic Clothing
messages.msgSnippet: How about this one?   We went to our local faire (King Richard s Faire in MA) a couple of years ago and loved it (Danielle bought Dragon Wings!).  I d love to
messages.messageBody:
How about this one? We went to our local faire (King Richard's Faire
in MA) a couple of years ago and loved it (Danielle bought Dragon
Wings!). I'd love to go again and told dh I'd dress as a "buxom wench"
if he also dressed appropriately (the jury's still out on that one!).

www.renstore.com

Jann

messages.subject: Re: OT - Gaelic/Celtic Clothing
messages.msgSnippet: Thanks for the well wishes!  We are going to attend the Ren Festival next weekend.  This weekend is already booked.  Thanks for the idea! I d not thought of it
messages.messageBody:
Thanks for the well wishes! We are going to attend the Ren Festival
next weekend. This weekend is already booked. Thanks for the idea!
I'd not thought of it otherwise. I can't wait! I've always wanted to
go, and now I have a good reason. Sorry that we will be missing the
kids' performance, though. :(

I'll let you know what we find...

Tina

messages.subject: RE: [unschoolingbasics] OT - Gaelic/Celtic Clothing
messages.msgSnippet: Wish I could help.  but congragulations.and they said it wouldn t last!!! Best wishes to your and your family. Geneva Goza Personal Chef Services 214-660-0231
messages.messageBody:
Wish I could help. but congragulations.and they said it wouldn't last!!!



Best wishes to your and your family.

From: unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com
[mailto:unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of Tina
Sent: Wednesday, August 10, 2005 8:03 PM
To: unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [unschoolingbasics] OT - Gaelic/Celtic Clothing



I am currently planning our wedding for NEXT MONTH, and have pretty
much nothing done. I've picked the honeymoon destination and
researched that, but that's it! We've been together for almost 10
years, and we have seven children. Yeah, I know...me plan a
wedding? Well, anyway, the job is upon me, and I need some
resources.

I have a catalog that has a beautiful Guinevere style dress that I'd
like to wear. No, I haven't ordered it yet. The catalog is "The
Pyramid Collection", and there is also a man's style poet's shirt
that I'd like for Pat. My dilemma is that we need shoes for both of
us that fit the attire and pants for Pat as well. I was thinking
maybe moccassins, but have not found any in black for men. I was
also thinking the baggy, drawstring style pants in black for Pat.

Does anyone know of an Online company that I could find these
things, or do you have any suggestions as to other ideas? I am of
Irish descent and really want to incorporate that in our wedding.
It is going to be VERY small. Our children, parents and a few close
couples will be the only people in attendance. I may have the
children be our wedding party, and my grandpa is going to walk me
down the aisle.

Any resources in this process would be GREATLY appreciated...

Thanks - Tina

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] OT - Gaelic/Celtic Clothing
messages.msgSnippet: Here is the website for Pyramid, if you don t already have it. http://www.pyramidcollection.com/ Find your local SCA group.  There will surely be someone there
messages.messageBody:
Here is the website for Pyramid, if you don't already have it.
http://www.pyramidcollection.com/

Find your local SCA group. There will surely be someone there (or someone
who knows someone) who will be able to make you a dress as authentic as you
like. http://sca.org/findsca.html The SCA is an invaluable resource for
anything historical pre-17th century.

Seven children in 10 years? I am impressed. Congratulation on your
upcoming nuptuals. I wish you both the best of luck.

Judy

messages.subject: RE: [unschoolingbasics] OT - Gaelic/Celtic Clothing
messages.msgSnippet: And our 4-H drama group is performing there, so come and say hi!!!! ~April Mom to Kate-19, Lisa-16, Karl-14, & Ben-9. *REACH Homeschool Grp, an inclusive group
messages.messageBody:
And our 4-H drama group is performing there, so come and say hi!!!!



~April
Mom to Kate-19, Lisa-16, Karl-14, & Ben-9.
*REACH Homeschool Grp, an inclusive group in Oakland County
<http://www.reachhomeschool.com> www.reachhomeschool.com

* Michigan Unschoolers
<http://groups.yahoo.com/group/michigan_unschoolers/>
http://groups.yahoo.com/group/michigan_unschoolers/
*Check out Chuck's art! <http://www.artkunst23.com/>
http://www.artkunst23.com
*Michigan Youth Theater...Acting On Our Dreams...
<http://www.michiganyouththeater.com/> http://www.michiganyouththeater.com

success."
Albert Einstein (1879-1955)

From: unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com
[mailto:unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of TreeGoddess
Sent: Wednesday, August 10, 2005 9:09 PM
To: unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] OT - Gaelic/Celtic Clothing




On Aug 10, 2005, at 9:03 PM, Tina wrote:

-=-Does anyone know of an Online company that I could find these
things, or do you have any suggestions as to other ideas?-=-

Tina!!! The Michigan Renaissance Festival starts THIS weekend! Go to
http://www.michrenfest.com for more info and directions. Discount tix
available through Kroger stores.

You'll save yourself a lot of hassle by being able to try them on and
check out many different kinds of shoes for the both of you and pants
for Pat. No shipping charges, no wrong sizes or colors. HTH

-Tracy-

"Peace *will* enter your life, but you
need to clear a spot for her to sit down."

messages.msgSnippet: Tina, I don t have any resources for you, but your plans sound absolutely lovely! I will pray that you find what you need and that the day goes well for you
messages.messageBody:
Tina,

I don't have any resources for you, but your plans sound absolutely lovely! I will pray that you find what you need and that the day goes well for you and your family, with beautiful weather!

:-) Elizabeth
